Mathematical ReferencesÂ¶

This page serves as a central index of all numbered equations used throughout the DIP_SMC_PSO documentation, providing quick access to mathematical results and their context.

System Dynamics EquationsÂ¶

Fundamental DynamicsÂ¶

()Â¶\[\frac{d}{dt}\left(\frac{\partial L}{\partial \dot{q}_i}\right) - \frac{\partial L}{\partial q_i} = Q_i\]

Context: Lagrangian formulation of the double-inverted pendulum system. Location: Complete System Dynamics

()Â¶\[\begin{split}\mat{M}(\vec{q}) = \begin{bmatrix} m_{total} & m_1 l_1 c_1 + m_2(l_1 c_1 + l_2 c_{12}) & m_2 l_2 c_{12} \\ m_1 l_1 c_1 + m_2(l_1 c_1 + l_2 c_{12}) & I_1 + m_1 l_1^2 + m_2 l_1^2 & m_2 l_1 l_2 c_2 \\ m_2 l_2 c_{12} & m_2 l_1 l_2 c_2 & I_2 + m_2 l_2^2 \end{bmatrix}\end{split}\]

Context: Inertia matrix for the three-degree-of-freedom system. Location: Complete System Dynamics

()Â¶\[\begin{split}\mat{C}(\vec{q}, \dot{\vec{q}}) = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & -m_1 l_1 s_1 \dot{\theta_1} - m_2(l_1 s_1 \dot{\theta_1} + l_2 s_{12}(\dot{\theta_1} + \dot{\theta_2})) & -m_2 l_2 s_{12}(\dot{\theta_1} + \dot{\theta_2}) \\ 0 & 0 & -m_2 l_1 l_2 s_2 \dot{\theta_2} \\ 0 & m_2 l_1 l_2 s_2 \dot{\theta_1} & 0 \end{bmatrix}\end{split}\]

Context: Coriolis and centripetal forces matrix. Location: Complete System Dynamics

State-Space RepresentationÂ¶

()Â¶\[\begin{split}\dot{\vec{x}} = \begin{bmatrix} \dot{\vec{q}} \\ \mat{M}^{-1}(\vec{q})[\vec{B}u - \mat{C}(\vec{q}, \dot{\vec{q}})\dot{\vec{q}} - \vec{G}(\vec{q})] \end{bmatrix}\end{split}\]

Context: Complete state-space representation of the nonlinear system. Location: Complete System Dynamics

Sliding Mode Control EquationsÂ¶

Sliding Surface DesignÂ¶

()Â¶\[s(\vec{x}) = \mat{S}\vec{x} = \vec{c}^T \vec{e} + \dot{\vec{e}}\]

Context: Linear sliding surface with tracking error dynamics. Location: Complete Sliding Mode Control Theory

()Â¶\[s \dot{s} \leq -\eta |s|\]

Context: Reaching condition for finite-time convergence to sliding surface. Location: Complete Sliding Mode Control Theory

Control LawsÂ¶

()Â¶\[u = u_{eq} + u_{sw} = -(\mat{S}\mat{B})^{-1}\mat{S}f(\vec{x}) - \eta \frac{s}{|s| + \epsilon}\]

Context: Classical sliding mode control with boundary layer. Location: Complete Sliding Mode Control Theory

()Â¶\[\begin{split}\begin{aligned} u &= u_1 + u_2 \\ \dot{u_1} &= -\alpha |s|^{1/2} \text{sign}(s) \\ u_2 &= -\beta \text{sign}(s) \end{aligned}\end{split}\]

Context: Super-twisting algorithm for chattering-free control. Location: Complete Sliding Mode Control Theory

()Â¶\[\dot{\hat{\theta}} = \Gamma s \sigma(\vec{x})\]

Context: Adaptive parameter estimation for uncertain systems. Location: Complete Sliding Mode Control Theory

Lyapunov Stability AnalysisÂ¶

()Â¶\[V(\vec{x}) = \frac{1}{2}s^T s + \frac{1}{2}\tilde{\theta}^T \Gamma^{-1} \tilde{\theta}\]

Context: Lyapunov function candidate for adaptive sliding mode control. Location: Complete Sliding Mode Control Theory

()Â¶\[\dot{V}(\vec{x}) = -\eta |s| \leq 0\]

Context: Lyapunov stability condition ensuring finite-time convergence. Location: Complete Sliding Mode Control Theory

()Â¶\[t_{reach} \leq \frac{V(0)}{\eta}\]

Context: Upper bound on reaching time to sliding surface. Location: Complete Sliding Mode Control Theory

PSO Optimization EquationsÂ¶

Particle DynamicsÂ¶

()Â¶\[\vec{v}_i^{(k+1)} = w\vec{v}_i^{(k)} + c_1 r_1(\vec{p}_i - \vec{x}_i^{(k)}) + c_2 r_2(\vec{g} - \vec{x}_i^{(k)})\]

Context: Velocity update equation for PSO particle motion. Location: Complete PSO Optimization Theory

()Â¶\[\vec{x}_i^{(k+1)} = \vec{x}_i^{(k)} + \vec{v}_i^{(k+1)}\]

Context: Position update equation for PSO particles. Location: Complete PSO Optimization Theory

Cost FunctionÂ¶

()Â¶\[J(\theta) = w_e \int_0^T \|\vec{e}(t)\|^2 dt + w_u \int_0^T u(t)^2 dt + w_s \int_0^T \dot{u}(t)^2 dt\]

Context: Multi-objective cost function for controller optimization. Location: Complete PSO Optimization Theory

Convergence and Stability TheoremsÂ¶

Theorem 1: Finite-Time ConvergenceÂ¶

Statement: Under the control law () with reaching condition (), the system state reaches the sliding surface in finite time bounded by ().

Proof: See Complete Sliding Mode Control Theory, Section 3.2.

Theorem 2: Asymptotic Stability on Sliding SurfaceÂ¶

Statement: Once on the sliding surface \(s = 0\), the tracking error converges exponentially to zero with rate determined by the sliding surface parameters.

Proof: See Complete Sliding Mode Control Theory, Section 3.3.

Theorem 3: Adaptive Parameter ConvergenceÂ¶

Statement: The adaptive law () ensures bounded parameter estimates and asymptotic tracking under persistence of excitation conditions.

Proof: See Complete Sliding Mode Control Theory, Section 4.2.
